contentBackground.img: Expensive Bottle of wine on shelf

panelText.text: Jian asks the sommelier how much the wine costs, and is told the bottle was sold for more than USD$200.

He refuses the wine, and enjoys his dinner. The next day, he tells his manager about what happened – and his manager points out that he shouldn’t have accepted the gift card either, as it is a cash equivalent.

Even though the best course of action would have been for Jian to decline the gift card, Jian is praised for speaking up after the fact, which allowed his manager and the Law department to handle the incident appropriately.
Jian’s manager gives the team training on the company’s gift policy, and discusses how to spot the signs of bribery, and how perception matters when giving and receiving gifts.
The Law team handles the communication with the supplier related to the gifting policy.
